answers.answer: Because they're impatient. Lol
Most have medical reasons

Pregnancy especially at the end is horrible, I'm not being induced I'm scheduled c section, but I can definitely see why some woman would do it, 40 weeks is a long time and the last month is severely uncomfortable for most mom's, if it's safe why not help the process
I will be induced because of medical issues to make sure baby and I make it out of this pregnancy as healthy as possible.
I can understand...scheduled c sections...and medical...issues. .but being induced....just because you asked....seems too easy .  Like people take advantage.

I have 3 children and one on the way. I was induced by choice with all 3 of my babies at 39 weeks and everything went perfect and they were all perfectly healthy. I chose to be induced mostly because the excitement got the best of me but also because I felt more comfortable scheduling it rather then waiting and not knowing when or where it would happen...that being said with this pregnancy im going to try my best to be patient and wait it out because I plan to make this my last and id kinda like to experience it spontaneously at least once...

I've never heard of anyone getting induced by request? from what I've studied & know, any real doctor wouldn't allow that. it has to be medically necessary.. as in if it's not done, it could threaten the life of the child or mother. if anyone knows of that happening, it should be reported & the doctor should lose his/her license to practice.I don't think you can just request to have it done at your convenience.

Being induced doesn't really make labor and delivery any easier I think its all equally hard regardless of how it started...I feel like if anything it just leaves a lil less room for error...Thats just my opinion though
A lot of doctors will induce upon request as long as the baby is healthy and fully developed but they wont do it any sooner then 39wks...

They induce if you are past the due date too. I know people that have induced by choice, if the baby is full term and the mother is healthy there isn't anything dangerous about it - although it doesn't always work right away. My mothers get pitocin during delivery if it progressing slowly, medically there isn't really anything different with that and being induced - it is the same drug

It is not illegal to request to be induced and a Dr agree, so please do not report anyone lol, as long as the mother is considered full term which is 39 weeks it's completely legal, however most drs will not do it until 40 weeks+
Oh ok. Understood.  In some cases.
Most are impatient. But after a certain point it gets unsafe to have baby in there. I'll wait 10 to 12 days late that's it for me.
Well since moms can't induce themselves the Dr must be in agreement that there aren't any medical issues then they'll go ahead and do it.  So really it must not be too bad. :/
There are people that chose to schedule c-sections for non-medical reasons.....

In the hospital by me they only let you get to 41wks then book you in for an induction,  ive never heard of anyone requesting it, 3 of my friend's and myself got induced due to be overdue, I think its quite hard going being induced its just as bad as doing it natural
Being induced is the worst! I wouldn't mind it at this point. I'm 35 weeks and my baby is 6lbs some odd ounces. My pelvis cand handle this
In the UK they will leave you till your 12days over due before they induce you unless its for a medical reason. Ive never heard of anyone requesting it here

hi.. i was induced with my first because she no longer had space in my tummy.. my waterbag even leaked and she wasnt moving.. i got induced exactly on my due date.. inducing me that time helped big time because if not, i would have lost more water and would end up having a c section-- which i didnt want and my doctor did not want either.. coz she said the healing process is way harder.. there are also some mothers who wants to be induced because some are just too scared to be overdue.. as long as the doctors approve of it, then everything should be ok.. for the mother and baby..

I do NOT want to be induced ever again! From no pain..no contractions..to an hour later full blown contractions...no breaks in between them...body going into shock. .vomitting..shaking. horrendous. Had no choice but to demand for the epidural. This ismy 2nd baby and my due date is tomorrow.well they have told me my due date was last week according to their measurements. ..but I know my due date..and am going to speak to the ob on Wednesday as I do not want to get induced when hes not even overdue. Here in the uk they give you until 42 weeks until they will induce you. Plusmy periods are every 35 days and so that makes a longer pregnancy.  :)

There are many reasons. Fear, medical, a high risk pregnancy.  Personally if my LO doesnt come on his own, I will be electively induced. Ive had someone very close to me lose a baby and quite frankly it DOES scare me. My LO is quite large already and I am very small, running out of room pretty quickly. I've been told I should go into labor on my own before 40 weeks just based on his size. But if it doesn't happen, Im opting for my health and my babys health, to induce around 39 weeks. My hubby and I as well as our doc,  all believe it is the best option for us :) So thats why we're inducing.

I plan on avoiding it if I can. Being induced with synthetic hormones increases your chances of haemhorraging because the fake hormone binds to oxytocin receptors and only oxytocin helps your uterus to contract afterwards... So with being induced you just don't get the oxytocin you need.My midwife is happy for me to go 14days plus overdue if I get ultrasounds to check that there is enough fluid and that the placenta is working well...Bring induced has its place - if I developed preeclampsia or my baby was in danger from low fluid or a dodgy umbilical cord I would absolutely go for it.
My doctor will induce at 39 weeks if I don't go into labor... so next week.... this is because I'm high risk and have a chance of getting preeclampsia and already have gestational diabetes

@salina: you clearly misunderstood me judging by your "lol" - there are factors that determine whether or not you can be induced.. you can't just place a request & get it, was my point. so yes, if a doctor does it "just because" it should be reported.. if a GOOD doctor does it, there's always a GOOD reason.. like many of the above women have stated. sorry, apparently I should have clarified that! ((((:
I'm getting induced for medical reasons......I waited it out with my first. I wish I could with this one also.
Actually,  You CAN ask for an induction. They normally wont do one before 39 weeks, but technically you can ask and its not illegal.

Who cares!! Does it honestly bother some of you THAT much?? Wow.. whatever is going on in another womans life and pregnancy is her problem. Don't sweat the pity things.. especially when it has absolutely nothing to do with you..
Pety*

I was induced with my first cuz of high blood pressure an I was in labor for 4 days I felt like I was dying I would NEVER ask for such torcher that was the worst pain ever an I not a wus by any means with my 2nd child I wanted the excitement of not knowing wen she was going come an she came exactly on her due date wen she was ready an I did that labor an delivery natural no pain med or nothing an being pregnant with my 3rd I can't wait to meet he or she but I want it to come when it ready not me.....

Its not a matter of bothering people I think. The question of why people induce was asked and I think alot of women were just giving their opinions or experiences. Not jumping down the throat of the person asking.

My sister was offered to be induced at 38 weeks. She said no that she'll let Robert come on his own time. A week and a half later she went into labor only to find out that the cord was wrapped around him neck and he had died the day before. To this day she thinks that if she was induced when they offered Robert would be ok.Now I struggle with the same question. If the doc say baby is healthy and can come out I think I will ask to be induced
Maybe it was 39 weeks
I was induced with my first because I was 10 days post my due date and they thought the baby was measuring too big. It didn't work for me either. Well over 24 hours later, I had a c-section.
Past* my due date

I honestly don't understand why women make it their business to tell other women what to do with their bodies.No one is asking you to choose induction. If you have the option and you don't want it then fine.  Don't sit there behind your phone or computer shaking your finger at someone else. You have no idea what they're going through, even if it's an elective induction its NOT your body.

question: Why is EVERYBODY being INDUCED??
title: Why not let your baby come when he/she is ready?¿¡
